meanings.definition: The quality or state of being torrid.
meanings.sent1: The torridity of the desert made it unbearable to walk outside.
meanings.sent2: The torridity of the sun beating down on us was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: Despite the torridity of the situation, she managed to keep her cool.
meanings.sent4: The torridity of their argument could be felt by everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The torridity of his anger was like a blazing fire in his eyes.

meanings.sent1: The torridity of the summer sun made the pavement too hot to touch.
meanings.sent2: We sought refuge from the torridity of the heat wave in the shade.
meanings.sent3: The torridity of the oven made baking cookies a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The torridity of the bonfire warmed us on the chilly night.
meanings.sent5: The torridity of the sauna enveloped us in a blanket of warmth.

meanings.sent1: The torridity of their love was evident in every glance they shared.
meanings.sent2: She spoke with such torridity about her favorite book that we all wanted to read it.
meanings.sent3: His torridity for adventure led him to explore unknown lands.
meanings.sent4: The torridity of her performance captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The torridity of his speech inspired us all to take action.
